events.title: Israel FM accuses Palestinian Authority of aiding terror with ‘Pay-for-Slay’ after deadly attack
events.description: Two Israelis were killed in terrorist attacks in Israel on Friday, as officials accused the Palestinian Authority of misleading the world about its active terror payment policy.

events.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports
events.description: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forces China has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan. The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...

events.title: Syrian Alawites protest after deadly mosque bombing
events.description: Members of Syria's Alawite minority protested in their thousands on December 28, days after an attack on an Alawite mosque killed eight people. Clashes between demonstrators and security forces broke out at some of the protests, with at least four people killed and dozens injured. The religious minority has become a target since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in December, the deposed dictator being an Alawite himself.

events.title: Unsung heroes of 2025: First responders and everyday Americans who saved lives across US
events.description: Heroes emerged from 2025's deadliest disasters as first responders and citizens risked everything to save lives during floods, shootings and rescues.

events.title: Ukraine: Theatre in Mariupol reopens after three years
events.description: A theatre that became a symbol of Russia’s 2022 siege of Mariupol has reopened after extensive restoration, Russian authorities said. State television showed a gala event and rebuilt interiors, including a marble staircase, columns and a large crystal chandelier. Amnesty International said at least 12 people were killed in the 2022 bombing.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Health system ‘on the verge of collapse’
events.description: The war in Sudan has been tearing the country apart for almost 1,000 days, putting the country’s health system under intolerable pressure. The World Health Organization (WHO) is reporting widespread disease outbreaks, severe shortages, malnutrition and rising deaths.

events.title: Syria: Guterres deplores deadly mosque blast in Homs
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres “unequivocally condemns” the deadly terrorist attack on a mosque in Homs, Syria during Friday prayers, his spokesperson said in a statement

events.title: Africa’s Christian Crisis: How 2025’s deadly attacks finally drew global attention after Trump’s intervention
events.description: Christian communities in Africa reportedly under siege as Islamist groups target churches and believers across multiple countries during Christmas 2025.

events.title: Anthony Joshua injured in car crash in Nigeria that killed two people
events.description: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuries Two people killed in collision, say police in Ogun State The British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning that killed two people, local police said. The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

events.title: Japanese town reeling from year of record bear encounters
events.description: Bears are becoming a growing problem in some of Japan’s urban areas as they are forced to venture further in search of food It came as no surprise, least of all to the residents of Osaki, that “bear” was selected as Japan’s kanji character of the year earlier this month. The north-eastern town of 128,000 people is best known for its Naruko Onsen hot springs, autumn foliage and kokeshi – cylindrical dolls carved from a single piece of wood. But this year it has made the headlines as a bear hotspot, as the country reels from a year of record ursine encounters and deaths, with warnings that winter will not bring immediate respite. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘My target was just to take the gun’: wounded hero Ahmed al-Ahmed speaks of saving lives at Bondi beach
events.description: ‘I know I saved lots, but I feel sorry for the lost,’ Ahmed tells CBS News of those who died in Sydney attack on 14 December Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Ahmed al-Ahmed, who disarmed one of the Bondi gunmen before being shot five times, says he knows his bravery saved many lives but is sad for those who were killed in the attack. In an interview with CBS News, Ahmed said he “didn’t worry about anything” except for the lives he could save as he disarmed Sajid Akram on 14 December. The act was caught on camera and shared around the world. Continue reading...

events.title: Hamas builds new terror regime in Gaza, recruiting teens amid problematic election
events.description: Hamas is recruiting teenage fighters during Gaza ceasefire after Israeli forces withdrew in October. This as national security analyst Professor Kobi Michael warns about growing militant control.

events.title: At least 13 people killed and 98 injured in train derailment in Mexico
events.description: Train accident in Oaxaca is likely to raise criticisms about public works projects from the previous administration At least 13 people were killed when a train derailed in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, in an accident which is likely to revive opposition criticisms of the speed and dealings with which the country’s government builds its flagship public works projects. The incident took place on the Interoceanic Train, which was built to link the Atlantic and Pacific oceans across the narrowest part of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, creating an alternative rail cargo route to the Panama canal intended to drive development in the region. Continue reading...

events.title: Panamean monument honouring China's contribution to Canal torn down
events.description: China has spoken out against the demolition of a monument near the entrance to the Panama Canal, celebrating the friendship of the two nations, with local authorities citing safety issues and an expired land concession. It comes amid warnings from Donald Trump over Beijing's influence over the key waterway, which he claims could threaten global trade and security.

events.title: Sri Lanka cyclone: More than a million still need aid weeks after Ditwah floods
events.description: Nearly a month after Cyclone Ditwah tore across Sri Lanka, more than a million people – including over half a million children – remain in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, as floods, landslides and renewed rainfall continue to compound one of the country’s worst disasters in decades.

events.title: More than 100,000 air passengers will face delays over China drills, Taiwan warns
events.description: Taiwan's Civil Aviation Administration said that the delay of roughly 296 international departures, 265 international arrivals and 296 transit flights affected by the live-fire drills that China launched around the island on Monday would snarl travel for more than 100,000 passengers.

events.title: 4 dead, dozens injured in Syria during clashes between Alawites and counterdemonstrators
events.description: At least four people have been killed and dozens wounded in clashes on Syria’s coast

events.title: Iran reportedly developing chemical, biological missile warheads as protests spread over collapsing economy
events.description: As Netanyahu meets Trump, intelligence suggests Iran accelerating chemical weapons work while facing unprecedented domestic unrest and economic crisis.

events.title: Mexico: At least 13 killed in Oaxaca train derailment
events.description: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum said more than 90 others were injured, some of whom remained in critical condition. An investigation is now underway.

events.title: Why the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant is a sticking point in Ukraine peace talks
events.description: Control over the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in east Ukraine has remained one of the main sticking points in peace negotiations since Russia took control of it in March 2022. Zaporizhzhia's proximity to the front lines has sparked international fears for the safety and stability of the nuclear plant, which is Europe's largest.

events.title: Hamas armed wing confirms spokesman Abu Obeida killed by Israeli strike in August
events.description: Hamas's armed wing confirmed on Monday the death of its spokesperson in a video statement, months after Israel announced he had been killed in an air strike in Gaza.

events.title: Two people killed in Anthony Joshua car crash named by Nigerian president
events.description: The two "close associates" of Anthony Joshua killed in a car crash in Nigeria in which the British boxer was injured have been named by the country's president.

events.title: Albanese’s refusal to heed families’ pleas for Bondi inquiry is hard to understand – and easy for opposition to attack
events.description: A review of Asio and the federal police is worthwhile, but it’s not a substitute for a royal commission into antisemitism Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast When Anthony Albanese opened a press conference on Monday announcing the release of terms of reference for an inquiry into the Bondi massacre, it seemed for a fleeting moment that he had belatedly agreed to hold a commonwealth royal commission. The timing would have been understandable, after the victims’ families had penned an open letter pleading for one, making the sort of intervention that can be politically untenable for any prime minister to refuse. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia says Ukraine attacked Putin's home, Kyiv calls this 'lie'
events.description: Russia accused Ukraine on Monday of having fired dozens of drones at one of President Vladimir Putin's homes, an accusation that Ukraine called a "lie" aimed at undermining US-led efforts to end the war. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who does not typically announce drone strikes, said Ukraine had fired "91 long-range unmanned aerial vehicles" at Putin's residence in the Novgorod region between late Sunday and early Monday, all of which were shot down.

events.title: Nine people, including five children, stabbed to death in Suriname
events.description: Police detained the male suspect after shooting him in the leg, while two others are seriously injured.

events.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
events.description: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’ Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago. The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

events.title: Peruvian shamans predict Maduro's fall, continued global conflicts in 2026
events.description: A group of Peruvian shamans gathered on a sacred hill overlooking Peru’s capital city to carry out an annual ritual in which they make predictions for the upcoming year

events.title: UN peacekeeper injured in gunfire near ‘Blue Line’ in south Lebanon
events.description: One United Nations peacekeeper was injured on Friday after heavy machine gunfire from Israel Defense Forces (IDF) positions south of the Blue Line, following a nearby grenade explosion, impacted close to a UN patrol in southern Lebanon.

events.title: Historic vote looms in Central African Republic as UN urges peaceful participation
events.description: With Central Africans set to vote in presidential, legislative, regional and long-delayed municipal elections this weekend, the United Nations has appealed for calm and restraint, warning that the credibility of the process will be critical to consolidating peace after years of conflict and instability.

events.title: Iranian president says his country is at 'total war' with the US, Israel and Europe: reports
events.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says his country is at 'total war' with the U.S., Israel and Europe, claiming the conflict is more complex than Iran's 1980s war with Iraq.

events.title: UK boxer Anthony Joshua injured in car crash in Nigeria
events.description: The former Olympic champion was in a car that was involved in an accident in Nigeria. Joshua will face countryman Tyson Fury in 2026.

events.title: Italian authorities arrest 9 people who allegedly used charities to funnel more than $8m to Hamas
events.description: Italy arrested nine people linked to three charities that allegedly funneled approximately $8.2 million to the Hamas terrorist organization.

events.title: North Korea says it tested long-range cruise missiles
events.description: North Korea says it fired long-range strategic cruise missiles into the sea to test the country’s nuclear deterrence

events.title: How climate change is threatening human rights
events.description: With rising effects of climate change across the globe, the world has started recognising that climate change is not just an ecological collapse, but also a human rights crisis.

events.title: Industrialisation without destruction: A UN blueprint for the future
events.description: Since the 19th century, industrialisation has had a transformative effect on the world, both positive and negative. It has created jobs and lifted millions out of poverty. But it has also had devastating consequences; destroying ecosystems, polluting the air, and driving the climate crisis that threatens to make large parts of the planet uninhabitable.

events.title: Trump vows to 'knock the hell out of' Iran if nuclear program is rebuilt again after high-stakes meeting
events.description: Trump warns Iran he'll 'knock the hell out of them' if nuclear program rebuilds, as new reports allegedly detail chemical weapons development for missiles.

events.title: Trump says US would back strikes against Iran’s missile programme
events.description: Speaking alongside Netanyahu, Trump threatens to 'knock' down Iran's attempts to rebuild its nuclear capabilities.

events.title: Boxer Anthony Joshua injured in deadly car crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer Anthony Joshua was injured in a car crash in Nigeria that killed two people, police say.

events.title: UN renews ceasefire push in Sudan
events.description: The UN has urged Sudan’s warring parties to pursue compromise and an immediate ceasefire, even as drone attacks, displacement and the killing of peacekeepers underscore the growing risks to civilians and humanitarians.

events.title: Overnight strikes leave death, destruction and power outages in Ukraine
events.description: A new wave of overnight strikes and front-line hostilities in Ukraine have caused further civilian casualties and damage to critical energy infrastructure, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Myanmar elections marked by fear as UN warns civilians are coerced from all sides
events.description: As Myanmar approaches elections scheduled for 28 December, the UN’s top human rights official has said that civilians are being coerced from all sides – forced by the military to vote and threatened by armed opposition groups to boycott – in a climate of fear, violence and mass repression.

events.title: Trump’s peace through strength in 2025: where wars stopped and rivals came to the table
events.description: Trump's 2025 peace agenda produced mostly positive results with new ceasefires in Gaza and other regions, but major conflicts like Ukraine remain unresolved.

events.title: 2025: Trump’s year of ’emergency’, ‘invasion’ and ‘narcoterrorism’
events.description: US president claims widespread and varied emergencies to justify executive authority in first year of second term.

events.title: Queensland to continue to allow farmers to shoot flying foxes after revoking ban on controversial practice
events.description: Conservationists and scientists criticise state for backtracking and say alternative non-lethal methods such as netting are more effective Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Queensland government has backtracked on plans to end the shooting of flying foxes from July 2026, continuing a practice wildlife advocates and scientists describe as “ineffective” and “inhumane”. Permits issued by the state’s environment department allow Queensland farmers to shoot flying foxes for the purposes of crop protection, up to an annual statewide quota set at 1,630 animals. That includes 130 grey-headed flying foxes, listed as vulnerable under federal environment laws, along with 700 black and 800 little red flying foxes. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Massive numbers' of police to be deployed for Sydney New Year's Eve celebrations
events.description: People in Sydney have been urged to show "defiance" and celebrate New Year's Eve in the wake of the deadly terror attack in Bondi Beach earlier this month.

events.title: Security Council remains divided over Iran nuclear programme, sanctions stay in place
events.description: At a meeting to discuss nuclear non-proliferation on Tuesday, the Security Council’s stance on Iran’s nuclear activities remained divided on the issue, split between those who support the reinstatement of sanctions, and the members who believe the sanctions should be permanently lifted, whilst questioning the legality of the meeting itself.

events.title: LIVE: Security Council meets on Venezuela, Iran, Somalia
events.description: The Security Council convened earlier today for a packed agenda, adopting a resolution extending the authorisation of the African Union support mission in Somalia (AUSSOM) and hearing a briefing on Iran and the implementation of resolution 2231, which endorsed the 2015 nuclear deal known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA). Members are set to reconvene at 3 pm for an emergency meeting requested by Venezuela, amid heightened tensions between Caracas and Washington. Assistant Secretary-General for Political Affairs Khaled Khiari is expected to brief ambassadors. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Tennessee officers rescue woman considering jumping from bridge on day after Christmas
events.description: New video shows a dramatic bridge rescue as law enforcement agencies worked together to save a woman in crisis on Interstate 81 in Sullivan County.

events.title: John Simpson: 'I've reported on 40 wars but I've never seen a year like 2025'
events.description: It has been a year of multiple major conflicts - and there are geopolitical implications of unparalleled importance

events.title: UN Security Council hears warnings over escalating US-Venezuela standoff
events.description: Tensions between the United States and Venezuela have sharply escalated amid increased US military operations in the Southern Caribbean, prompting accusations of sovereignty violations, concerns over civilian harm and growing calls at the UN Security Council for restraint and de-escalation.

events.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine, ahead of Trump meeting, is 'willing to do whatever it takes' to end war with Russia
events.description: Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv reportedly kills one, injures 27 as Ukraine's president prepares for crucial Trump meeting with peace proposal.

events.title: Deadly protests and clashes in Syria – what happened and what’s next?
events.description: Unrest grips Syria's Mediterranean cities after a deadly mosque attack sparks demonstrations.

events.title: Protests, strikes after Iran’s economic situation rapidly deteriorates
events.description: Iranians are further squeezed every day amid a tanking economy, an energy crisis, water bankruptcy and lethal pollution.

events.title: Influx of cheap Chinese imports could drive down UK inflation, economists say
events.description: As Trump’s tariffs take effect, Britain is likely alternative destination for cars, telecoms and sound equipment Business live – latest updates The UK is poised for an influx of cheap Chinese imports that could bring down inflation amid the fallout from Donald Trump’s global trade war, leading economists have said. After figures showed China’s trade surplus surpassed $1tn (£750bn) despite Washington’s tariff policies hitting exports to the US, the Bank of England said the UK was among the nations emerging as alternative destinations for the goods. Continue reading...

events.title: Turkey: 9 dead in police raid on 'Islamic State' group
events.description: The Turkish Interior Ministry mourned the loss of thee security force members as police moved in on a suspected hideout. Six Islamist militants were reported to have been killed in the operation.

events.title: Germany news: Fireworks back on sale, reignite ban debate
events.description: Germany's perennial debate over safety has flared up once again as fireworks sales resume ahead of New Year. Meanwhile, a spate of black ice has caused numerous accidents across the country. Follow our updates.

events.title: Families of Bondi Beach victims demand more federal action
events.description: Families of victims of the recent Sydney massacre are urging more federal action to investigate rising antisemitism and security failures

events.title: Major cities see violent crime surge as national rates plummet significantly in 2025: survey
events.description: New survey reveals violent crime rose in major U.S. cities despite nationwide decline, with some areas reporting increases in homicides and assaults.

events.title: What we know about deadly clashes after protests in Syria
events.description: Syrian government troops have been deployed after demonstrations sparked by a mosque explosion led to deadly clashes.

events.title: Hamas armed wing confirms death of⁠ Abu Obeida, other leaders
events.description: The group also confirmed the death of former Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar.

events.title: Three police officers and six militants killed in shooting in Turkey
events.description: Six militants and three police officers have been killed during a shoot-out after extremists clashed with authorities in Turkey.

events.title: Indonesian rescuers find a body while searching for soccer coach and 3 children
events.description: Indonesian rescuers say they have recovered the body of a female victim believed to be part of the family of a Spanish soccer coach and his three children, missing after a tour boat sank Friday

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Central African Republic goes to polls as president seeks third term
events.description: Opposition hopes to tap into frustrations of people living in country where conflict remains a daily reality Central African Republic goes to the polls on Sunday with the president, Faustin-Archange Touadéra, seeking a third term. As many as 2.3 million registered voters will cast ballots for what observers are calling a quadruple election: votes for the presidency and parliament as well as local and municipal offices. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela says it released 99 people detained for 2024 election protests
events.description: Government said the move was due to its ‘unrestricted respect for human rights’ in the face of US aggression Venezuela has said it has carried out its largest release of political prisoners this year, claiming to have freed 99 people detained for taking part in protests after the 2024 election, widely believed to have been stolen by the dictator Nicolás Maduro , as it comes under increasing military pressure from the US. Civil society organisations have treated the news with caution and stressed that the releases were insufficient, noting that at least 900 political prisoners remain in the country. Continue reading...

events.title: North Korea tests long-range cruise missiles: state media
events.description: Kim Jong Un personally oversaw the launching drill for new long‑range cruise missiles, according to state media. The test marks the latest flashpoint in tensions over Pyongyang's expanding nuclear ambitions.

events.title: At least 3 dead, including 1-year-old, in building collapse in South Africa
events.description: Three people, including a child, have died after a two-story building collapsed in Soweto, South Africa

events.title: Manhunts across America in 2025: Five cases that left cities, campuses and towns on edge
events.description: From Louisiana jails to Washington wilderness, police launched massive searches for escaped killers who terrorized local neighborhoods throughout 2025.

events.title: Zelenskyy denies Russian claim of Ukrainian strike on Putin residence
events.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy quickly denied a Russian claim that Ukraine attacked Vladimir Putin’s home in the city of Novgorod.

events.title: Chinese military stages drills around Taiwan to warn 'external forces'
events.description: The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at U.S. arms sales, and a statement by Japan's prime minister saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.

events.title: A knife attack outside Suriname's capital kills at least nine people, including children, police say
events.description: A knife attack outside Suriname's capital kills at least nine people, including children, police say

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza aid restrictions, Syria humanitarian needs, lawyer reprisals in Burundi
events.description: The UN and partners continue to provide assistance to people in Gaza, where recent winter storms have worsened conditions for thousands across the enclave.

events.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as warning to 'separatist forces'
events.description: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.

events.title: Three killed in Sweden as major storm sweeps across Nordic countries
events.description: Thousands of homes in parts of Finland, Sweden and Norway have been left without power.

events.title: Boy, 5, died after arm trapped in ski resort travelator in Japan
events.description: Hinata Goto reportedly fell as he was trying to get off the 30-metre-long walkway A five-year-old boy has died after becoming trapped in a moving travelator at a ski resort in northern Japan, local media have said. The victim, Hinata Goto, died on Sunday after his right arm became trapped in the walkway’s winding mechanism during a family skiing trip to Otaru, a city on Japan’s northernmost island of Hokkaido. Continue reading...

events.title: Ten years since David Dungay Jr died in jail, a rally to protest deaths in custody could test NSW’s new laws
events.description: Dunghutti man’s nephew says fight for justice ‘is not just political – it is spiritual, cultural and about survival’ Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Since his uncle died in custody at one of New South Wales’ toughest prisons a decade ago, Paul Silva has been advocating for change almost daily. From organising large-scale rallies with thousands in attendance to sitting through numerous coronial inquiries and supporting families, he says the right to protest is needed now more than ever. The nephew of David Dungay Jr , a Dunghutti man who died at the age of 26 at Long Bay jail in Sydney’s southern suburbs on 29 December 2015, Silva says the fight for justice “is not just political – it is spiritual, cultural and about survival”. Continue reading...

events.title: Syria: Construction of new tunnels in Raqqa sparks fears of renewed conflict
events.description: As the March 10 agreement between the Syrian government and the Syrian Democratic Forces nears its end, more and more new tunnels are under construction in residential neighbourhoods in Raqqa, in northeastern Syria. Locals told us that they are concerned about the underground militarisation of their city.

events.title: Chinese military drills a warning to 'separatist forces' and 'external interference' in Taiwan
events.description: China has launched sea and air military drills around Taiwan, which it claims as its own. Riled by a US arms package to the island nation and Japan saying it would intervene in the case of an invasion, it calls its war games a warning against what it calls separatist forces and external interference. The drills are the sixth carried out in Taiwan's vicinity since 2022, adding to fears an invasion could happen in the next few years.

events.title: Chinese aircraft and navy conduct drills around Taiwan in warning against 'external interference'
events.description: China has conducted more military drills around Taiwan in a warning against "external interference".

events.title: This is what happened after recent Netanyahu meetings with US Presidents
events.description: Netanyahu is set to meet the US president again, with past meetings since the Gaza war followed by regional escalation.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: M 6.0 - 2025 Taitung, Taiwan Earthquake
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - VII DYFI? - VI Time 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC at epicenter Location 22.851°N 121.207°E Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: Bulgaria joining eurozone is big deal
events.description: The southeastern European country is set to ditch its national currency in favor of the euro. But while Bulgaria's economy has improved, mismanagement and corruption remain rampant.

events.title: Mexico train crash kills 13 and injures almost 100
events.description: An investigation is under way after the train derailed as it rounded a bend near the town of Nizanda.

events.title: Russian energy: Taiwan's weak link in China conflict?
events.description: Despite vows to cut back, Russian hydrocarbons continue flowing to Taiwan, making it Moscow's biggest buyer of the naphta derivative, and raising concerns over energy dependence.

events.title: 'One or two thorny issues' remain after Ukraine peace deal talks, Trump says
events.description: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they have made "a lot of progress" towards finalising a peace agreement to end Russia's war in Ukraine - although "one or two very thorny issues" remain.

events.title: Protesting students in Serbia urge support for early election they hope will oust Vucic
events.description: Protesting university students in Serbia have collected signatures throughout the country for their request for an early parliamentary election

events.title: Feds launch 'massive' investigation after viral video alleges Minnesota daycare fraud
events.description: Federal agents launch investigation into alleged Minnesota childcare fraud following viral video exposing suspicious daycare centers receiving millions.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: The U.S. offers Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee for now, Zelenskyy says
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.

events.title: First Person: Felipe Paullier, the youngest ever senior UN official, charged with giving a voice to young people around the world
events.description: A paediatrician by training, Felipe Paullier has long been an advocate for youth. Formerly Director of the Uruguayan Government's Youth Institute, a role which involved several joint actions with various UN agencies, he was appointed to run the UN Youth Office in 2023, the youngest senior appointment in United Nations history.

events.title: Paper and wood: Forest products show signs of recovery, UN agency says
events.description: From wood-based panels used in construction, to charcoal for cooking food, forest products are valued and traded all around the world.

events.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
events.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

events.title: Six alleged ISIL fighters killed in overnight raid in northwestern Turkiye
events.description: At least six suspected ISIL fighters and three Turkish police officers were killed after a shootout in Turkiye.

events.title: Ukrainian soldiers target Russian drones with rifles
events.description: Video released by the Ukrainian military showed soldiers shooting down small Russian drones with their rifles.

events.title: Trump live: US president meets with Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu
events.description: Trump's meeting with Netanyahu comes after he touted progress in achieving a resolution to Russia's war in Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Weather tracker: Deep freeze grips Canada as US records warmest Christmas
events.description: Temperatures plunge below -50C in the Yukon, while swaths of US experience springlike weather Northern Canada has been gripped by an intense and prolonged cold spell, with temperatures hovering between -20C and -40C for weeks. On Tuesday, Braeburn in the Yukon recorded -55.7C, its coldest December temperature since 1975. Meanwhile, Mayo and Dawson endured 16 consecutive nights below -40C, with Mayo plunging to -50.4C on Monday. Whitehorse also recorded 10 nights when temperatures dropped below -30C. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says there's progress on a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
events.description: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they are making progress on a peace deal to end the war in Russia after meeting in Mar-a-Lago Sunday.

events.title: Trump and Netanyahu to meet in Florida at a crucial moment for the Gaza ceasefire
events.description: President Trump could use the face-to-face at his Mar-a-Lago estate to look for ways to speed up the peace process, as Israel's leader has been accused of not pushing his side to move fast enough.

events.title: Myanmar: An election with no real choice
events.description: Myanmar is holding its first election since the 2021 coup, but low turnout, civil war and the absence of real opposition have cast doubt on whether the vote can deliver stability or legitimacy.

events.title: Russia says Ukraine attacked Putin's residence, Kyiv denies
events.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov claimed Ukraine had attempted to attack President Vladimir Putin's residence with drones. Volodymyr Zelenskyy called it a fabrication made to undermine peace talks. DW has more.

events.title: Ukraine: What is blocking the peace deal negotiations?
events.description: Speaking at a joint press conference, both US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were cautiously optimistic about negotiations over the 20-point peace plan for Ukraine. But progress made doesn't include issues of security guarantees for Ukraine, nor the country's eastern Donbas region. So what is blocking the negotiations?

events.title: Zelenskyy's reaction to Trump said it all as his poker face slipped after peace talks
events.description: Not going backwards is a win. Given Donald Trump's fraught relationship with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, that's important.

events.title: Three war fronts on the agenda as Netanyahu set for talks with Trump
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is on his way to meet US President Donald Trump in Florida.

events.title: Illegal immigrant allegedly severs man's thumb with machete at Georgia Christmas holiday party
events.description: Christmas party in Georgia turns violent as man allegedly attacks guest with machete, severing thumb. Victim hospitalized with serious injuries.

events.title: Missing 19-year-old Camila Mendoza Olmos believed to be 'in imminent danger,' Texas sheriff says
events.description: Bexar County Sheriff Javier Salazar noted that it is thought that the 19-year-old who went missing on Christmas Eve, Camila Mendoza Olmos, is "in imminent danger."

events.title: Cellphone data defined 2025’s biggest criminal cases as expert calls them a 'crime scene in their pocket'
events.description: Forensic expert warns cellphones are "crime scenes" in your pocket as digital evidence plays increasingly key role in cases like Karen Read trial.

events.title: Pennsylvania man charged after killing mother, wounding father after Christmas
events.description: A Pennsylvania man man was charged for allegedly shooting his parents the day after Christmas, killing his mother and wounding his father.

events.title: Zelenskyy denies Russian claim that Ukraine attacked Putin residence
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calls alleged drone attack on Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence a "complete fabrication" as tensions escalate between Ukraine and Russia.

events.title: Trump meets with Zelenskyy; talks could unlock first Zelenskyy-Putin call in five years: source
events.description: President Donald Trump assumes mediator role as talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy focus on a U.S.-backed 20-point peace plan that could end the war in Ukraine.

events.title: UK flag clash as foreign banners fly, citizens push back against woke policies reshaping Britain
events.description: New polling reveals deep splits over Union Jack symbolism as Britain's changing demographics fuel heated debate about national flags and identity.

events.title: Stabbing spree, chemical attack at Japan factory injures 15
events.description: A 38-year-old male suspect is in custody following an alleged stabbing spree and chemical attack at a Yokohama Rubber Co. tire factory in central Japan.

events.title: Trump meets Netanyahu in Florida as focus turns to Middle East issues
events.description: They are set to discuss Iran, Lebanon, Syria and Gaza, where the Trump administration wants to see the ceasefire enter its second stage in January.

events.title: SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI
events.description: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boom SoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio. The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...

events.title: Netanyahu to discuss Gaza ceasefire with Trump without 'antagonising his base back home'
events.description: US President Donald Trump is expected to ⁠push for progress in the stalled ceasefire in Gaza when he meets with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for talks on December 29 that will include Israel's concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran. For Netanyahu, the meeting comes amid domestic dissatisfaction over his management of the situation. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky tells us what's at stake for the Israeli PM straight from Jerusalem.

events.title: Netanyahu and Trump to meet for talks on Gaza peace plan and Iran
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to meet Donald Trump in Florida on December 29, with the US president pushing to move to the next stage of his fragile Gaza truce plan. Netanyahu is also expected to try to shift some focus onto Iran, amid reports he will call for more US strikes on the Islamic republic. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley tells us more on what to expect from this meeting.

events.title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking newly signed ceasefire deal
events.description: The ceasefire took effect at noon local time (05:00 GMT) on Saturday.

events.title: Kosovo's ruling party wins election after months of political deadlock
events.description: The decisive victory for the Albanian nationalist Vetevendosje party means a third term for leader Albin Kurti.

events.title: Spaniards hurl flour, eggs and fireworks in mock battle
events.description: The annual food fight festival ''Els Enfarinats'' has left the Spanish town of Ibi covered in flour and egg shells.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: New game reserves set to reshape rural life in northern Tanzania
events.description: A battle over land use is unfolding between northern Tanzania's breathtaking Lake Natron and national parks. Evictions from ancestral land to accommodate tourism projects has already driven some Maasai to the brink.

events.title: Baby, you're a fire hazard: Fireworks stash seized in Berlin
events.description: Local police said that a Berlin man bragged to guests that he kept large quantities of fireworks, which led to them receiving a tip.

events.title: Russia sends 3 Iranian satellites into orbit, report says
events.description: Iran's state television says that Russia has sent three Iranian communications satellites into orbit

events.title: Guineans vote in first election since 2021 coup with junta leader likely to win
events.description: Guineans were voting to elect a new president in the country’s first election since a 2021 coup

events.title: Photos show flour, eggs and firecrackers flying at Spain's Els Enfarinats festival
events.description: Revelers take part in the Els Enfarinats festival, a battle using flour, eggs and firecrackers in the Spanish town of Ibi. This is a photo gallery curated by Associated Press photo editors.

events.title: South Korean President Lee returns to presidential palace avoided by predecessor
events.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on Monday commuted to Cheong Wa Dae, the country’s traditional presidential palace, for the first time since taking office in June, more than three years after his ousted predecessor Yoon Suk Yeol moved the presiden...

events.title: Central African Republic's incumbent president, a Russian ally, eyes a third term in key elections
events.description: The Central African Republic voted on Sunday to elect a new president and federal lawmakers

events.title: Police sergeant denies hearing Luigi Mangione mother's alleged damning statement about CEO killing
events.description: Attorney Karen Friedman Agnifilo says Luigi Mangione's mother never made the statement about the UnitedHealthcare CEO assassination that police claimed.

events.title: Judge rules redacted transcript, audio recording of sealed Charlie Kirk hearing can be released
events.description: Accused assassin of Charlie Kirk appeared remotely in court Monday for hearing on media access to his capital murder case proceedings in Provo, Utah, this week.

events.title: Charlie Kirk’s killing, Idaho murders plea and Karen Read verdict: Inside 2025’s biggest crime moments
events.description: From assassination plots to brutal murders, 2025's most captivating cases revealed shocking twists in crimes that dominated news cycles nationwide.

events.title: Israel becomes first country to recognize Somaliland; Trump 'not ready'
events.description: Israel became the first country to officially recognize Somaliland as an independent nation in a historic diplomatic move tied to the Abraham Accords framework.

events.title: How serious are the sectarian tensions facing Syria?
events.description: Alawite protesters confront government supporters in coastal cities.

events.title: ‘A tough neighbourhood’’: Trump says Gaza rebuilding to start soon
events.description: President Trump said he wants to move to phase two of the Gaza ceasefire “quickly” if Hamas disarms soon.

events.title: Pro-Palestine activists target UK Labour offices over hunger strikers
events.description: Activists accuse the government of refusing to engage with the detainees’ demands.

events.title: ‘We’ll knock the hell out of them’: Trump threatens Iran
events.description: Donald Trump threatened Iran and said “we’ll knock the hell out of them” if Tehran rebuilds its military forces.

events.title: Thailand, Cambodia agree to build on ceasefire in talks in China’s Yunnan
events.description: Countries meet for a second day of negotiations after a truce agreed on Saturday to halt weeks of fighting.

events.title: US struck ‘big facility’ in Venezuela, Trump claimed without offering details
events.description: Trump alleged that US forces hit ‘very hard’ in what would mark his team’s first land strike on Venezuela if confirmed Donald Trump has claimed that US forces struck a “big facility” in Venezuela last week – but the president did not specify what it was, or where, and the White House has not commented further. “We just knocked out – I don’t know if you read or you saw – they have a big plant, or a big facility, where the ships come from. Two nights ago, we knocked that out. So we hit them very hard,” Trump told Republican donor and New York supermarket owner John Catsimatidis on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Do Trump's claims about Christian persecution in Nigeria match reality?
events.description: Aaron Zelin, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, analyzes the U.S. strike on ISIS targets in Nigeria and the message it sends.

events.title: Updates: Netanyahu, Trump meet to discuss Gaza, Iran
events.description: The Israeli Prime Minister is meeting US President Donald Trump in Florida to discuss Gaza and Iran. The meeting comes as the second phase in the Gaza ceasefire looms. DW has more.

events.title: China stages drills around Taiwan to deter 'external' forces
events.description: Taiwan accused China of military intimidation after Beijing announced live-fire drills. It comes after Japan's prime minister said Tokyo could potentially intervene to defend the self-governing island.

events.title: Gaza truce: Where does it stand and what's supposed to happen under phase two?
events.description: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu are meeting in Florida for talks that will cover the next phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal. Washington wants to see it move to the second phase in January 2026, but Israel and Hamas both accuse each other of breaching the first phase of the agreement. Andrew Hilliar breaks down where the deal currently stands and what's supposed to happen in phase two.

events.title: Taiwan vows to defend democracy as Chinese threat looms
events.description: Taipei has condemned 'military intimidations' from Beijing as China started military drills off the cost of the island nation, simulating a blockade of its main ports. The operation 'further confirm its nature as an aggressor, making it the greatest destroyer of peace', said its defence ministry. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks at why these drills are happening now, and what to expect.

events.title: Why China is holding military drills around Taiwan — and the history behind it
events.description: China’s decision to bring serious firepower to bear for military drills in the waters off Taiwan this week has deep roots both in the past several weeks and the past several decades

events.title: 2025 Most Memorable Patriotic Moments: December 29, 2025
events.description: Choose between the Second Inauguration of Donald Trump, the Launch of the America 250 Campaign, or Trump attending the 9/11 Yankees Game.

events.title: Nigeria says it shared intelligence to support US strikes on ISIS
events.description: Nigeria confirmed it shared intelligence with the U.S. ahead of Christmas night airstrikes against ISIS targets accused of killing Christians.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Taiwan: China's massive military drills stir invasion fears
events.description: Beijing's largest drills in years simulate a blockade of Taiwan, testing US resolve and regional security as political tensions and arms deals escalate.

events.title: Arms deal with Taiwan is a bargaining chip for Trump in negotiations with China
events.description: As China holds military drills around Taiwan to deter what it calls separatist forces, why is it happening now? Several reasons include the United States' multi-billion arms deal to Taipei, at a time where the Trump administration is trying to woe the Chinese government on trade. While the US is bound by law to protect Taipei, Trump also sees it as a bargaining chip. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.

events.title: Development cooperation agreement marks new phase in UN-Iraq partnership
events.description: Better access to education, the protection of the environment and good governance are some of the areas in which the United Nations helps countries improve.

events.title: DR Congo: Displaced people in South Kivu close to ‘utter desperation’, WFP says
events.description: An estimated 500,000 people have been forced from their homes since fighting erupted in South Kivu province, Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), at the beginning of December.

events.title: Illegal immigrants allegedly ran multi-million-dollar gift card fraud scheme hitting stores daily across Texas
events.description: Texas authorities arrested three illegal immigrants from Eastern Europe accused of running a sophisticated $14 million gift card fraud scheme across several states.

events.title: Texas substitute teacher charged with child sex offenses, 'no longer employed' by school district
events.description: Texas substitute teacher charged with aggravated sexual assault of a child in case involving multiple felony counts and child pornography possession.

events.title: ICE delivers 'greatest gift of all' with Christmas arrests of convicted criminals across multiple states
events.description: DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin praised ICE agents who arrested "gang members, murderers, drug traffickers" on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

events.title: Russian forces near collapse in Kupyansk as Moscow allies concede city lost: report
events.description: Russian forces were reportedly cut off and surrendering in Ukraine's Kupyansk as supply lines fail. Only dozens of isolated troops remain in the strategic city.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: First UN visit to Sudan's El-Fasher finds traumatised civilians amid reports of mass atrocities
events.description: Traumatised civilians left in Sudan's El-Fasher after its capture by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces are living without water or sanitation, UN aid coordinator Denise Brown told the AFP news agency on Monday, after a small humanitarian team was able to make its first visit there in almost two years.

events.title: From Gaza to Iran: What’s at stake in Trump-Netanyahu Mar-a-Lago talks?
events.description: Gaza peace plan and Iran both reportedly on agenda as President Donald Trump is set to meet Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago on Monday.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot to be buried January 7 at Saint-Tropez cemetery
events.description: The funeral for French cinema icon Brigitte Bardot will take place in her hometown of Saint-Tropez on January 7, her foundation said on Monday, as France wrestles with how to pay tribute to a cultural legend who in her later years championed far-right views, even being fined for hate speech.

events.title: Nepal to scrap 'failed' Mount Everest waste deposit scheme
events.description: Under the scheme, climbers paid a $4,000 deposit that was returned if they brought 8kg of waste down the mountain.

events.title: US pledges $2bn for humanitarian aid, but tells UN 'adapt or die'
events.description: The pledge was welcomed by the UN, but comes after previous major cuts to US funding for humanitarian operations.

events.title: 'There are many challenges': Syrians in Turkey consider return after fall of Assad
events.description: Syrians in Turkey are weighing up whether it is the right time to return to their homeland.

events.title: Bondi hero says he wanted to stop gunman killing innocent people
events.description: Authorities say the actions of Ahmed al Ahmed, a shop owner, saved countless lives.

events.title: Egyptian dissident sorry for tweets after calls for deportation from UK
events.description: Shabana Mahmood is facing growing calls to revoke the citizenship of Alaa Abdel Fattah after the emergence of social media posts.

events.title: French cinema actress Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.description: The actress was a symbol of sexual liberation in the 1950s but became increasingly controversial after making homophobic and racist slurs.

events.title: Five-year-old boy dies after getting caught in Japan ski travelator
events.description: Officials spent 40 minutes dismantling the travelator to free him, but he was later pronounced dead.

events.title: Polls close on first day of Myanmar's widely criticised 'sham' election
events.description: Observers say the vote, accompanied by a renewed crackdown on dissent, is meant to entrench the junta's power.

events.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro undergoes medical treatment for hiccups
events.description: The 70-year-old had suffered with the spasms for nine months, his wife says, and was already in hospital for hernia surgery.

events.title: Nine arrested in Italy for allegedly raising millions for Hamas
events.description: Police say the suspects raised around €7m (£6m) for the militant group over more than two years.

events.title: South Africa edge Zimbabwe 3-2 to book AFCON 2025 knockout place
events.description: Meanwhile, a second-string Egypt side maintains their unbeaten record in a goalless draw with Angola.

events.title: New Iraqi parliament holds first session, elects speaker
events.description: Haybat al-Halbousi, from the Taqaddum (Progress) Party, has been elected as speaker of the new parliament.

events.title: Myanmar pro-military party claims huge lead in contentious elections
events.description: UN human rights chief condemns the elections, citing a crackdown on dissent.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: More than 3,000 migrants died trying to reach Spain in 2025
events.description: Tighter border controls caused arrivals to decline sharply but forced people on to more dangerous routes, activists say More than 3,000 people died trying to reach Spain by sea over the past year, a sharp fall from the previous 12 months. However, activists cautioned that the drop reflected tighter border controls that have forced migrants to take increasingly dangerous routes. Continue reading...

events.title: Opposition anger as Guinea’s junta leader is frontrunner to be elected president
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya accused of betraying his promise to be the restorer of democracy after leading 2021 coup In September 2021, a tall, young colonel in the Guinean army announced that he and his comrades had forcibly seized power and toppled the longtime leader Alpha Condé. “The will of the strongest has always supplanted the law,” Mamady Doumbouya said in a speech, stressing that the soldiers were acting to restore the will of the people. Continue reading...

events.title: Brazilian ex-president Bolsonaro treated for persistent hiccups
events.description: Doctors say they blocked his right phrenic nerve in procedure that took place after jailed former president was hospitalised last week for hernia operation Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro underwent “a phrenic nerve block procedure” on Saturday to treat his persistent hiccups, his wife, Michelle Bolsonaro, said on social media. The doctors treating Bolsonaro said later that they blocked the right phrenic nerve and scheduled a new procedure in 48 hours to block the left one. Continue reading...

events.title: Pauline Hanson travelled to US on Gina Rinehart’s private jet to attend CPAC
events.description: Exclusive: One Nation senator travelled on mining magnate’s Gulfstream 700 in October and is yet to declare it on parliamentary register Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Pauline Hanson and her chief of staff, James Ashby, flew to Florida on Gina Rinehart’s private jet in October, but the One Nation senator is yet to declare the sponsored travel or answer questions about whether she may be in breach of parliamentary rules. Guardian Australia can reveal the One Nation senator and her staffer travelled with Rinehart on the mining magnate’s Gulfstream 700 on 27 October, with publicly available flight tracking data showing that the aircraft travelled from Brisbane to Perth before flying via Osaka to Palm Beach. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says Ukraine peace is closer. And, how funding cuts affect anti-poverty groups
events.description: Trump and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled momentum on peace talks after a meeting yesterday. And, anti-poverty groups address challenges they are facing that impact Americans who need help.

events.title: Ex-Pentagon official on the prospects of a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
events.description: Ukraine's president visited Mar-a-Lago Sunday. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former Pentagon official Evelyn Farkas, now executive director of the McCain Institute, about prospects for peace.

events.title: Morning news brief
events.description: Trump says progress is being made on a deal between Ukraine and Russia, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump Monday, anti-poverty groups are bracing for what lies ahead after a year of chaos.

events.title: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to meet with President Trump in Florida
events.description: The Israeli Prime Minister will meet President Trump in Florida Monday, with talks expected to focus on the next phases of the peace plan for Gaza.

events.title: How President Trump has reshaped U.S.-Israel relations
events.description: With Israel's prime minister at the White House Monday, former peace negotiator Aaron David Miller speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about the ways President Trump has reshaped U.S.-Israel relations.

events.title: New Year's Eve: How to make resolutions for 2026
events.description: Quit smoking, exercise more, eat healthier: Every January 1, we plan to do great things over the next year — only to fail most of the time. Here's how to make sure your New Year's resolutions work out.

events.title: Lufthansa and the role of big business in the Holocaust
events.description: German airline Lufthansa is one of many big-name brands that collaborated with the Nazis during the Holocaust. As the airline celebrates its 100th anniversary, why does its Nazi past continue to fly under the radar?

events.title: Aurora lights: The science behind the dazzling nighttime spectacle
events.description: The northern and southern lights have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.description: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.description: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: Kosovo: Kurti wins snap election, signalling end of impasse
events.description: Prime Minister Kurti's governing Self-Determination party won nearly 50% of the vote, results showed with most of the votes counted. It is not yet clear whether he will be able to form a cabinet without a coalition.

events.title: George and Amal Clooney and family become French citizens
events.description: Hollywood superstar George Clooney has become French, along with his wife Amal Alamuddin Clooney and their two children, an official decree seen by AFP on Monday showed.

events.title: Taiwan: Chinese military releases footage of drills around the island
events.description: The Chinese army has released footage it says shows destroyers, frigates, fighter jets and bombers carrying out exercises around Taiwan. The large-scale show of force comes amid heightened tensions, notably following a major US arms sale to the island and after weeks of diplomatic disputes between Beijing and Tokyo.

events.title: Race for AFCON knockout stages intensifies
events.description: South Africa is to play Zimbabwe in a decisive group B clash after losing to Egypt, automatically qualifying the Pharaohs to the round of 16. For South Africa, it's a matter of laying down their credentials as contenders. In the meantime, host nation Morocco is expected to also join the knockout stages, with the confirmation to come if they win their last group stage game against Zambia. FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes updates us on AFCON from Rabat.

events.title: 'Right' for British-Egyptian activist to apologise over social media posts, says Downing Street
events.description: Downing Street has said it was right for a freed British-Egyptian activist to apologise following the discovery of "abhorrent" social media posts.

events.title: At least 13 people dead after train derails in Mexico
events.description: At least 13 people have died and dozens more are being treated for their injuries after a train derailed in Mexico, authorities have said.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot: The bombshell and style icon who walked away from fame and glamour
events.description: Brigitte Bardot was the sultry film siren who helped ignite a sexual revolution, a woman whose cultural significance extended beyond her acting career.

events.title: Hungary's 'water guardian' farmers fight back against desertification
events.description: Southern Hungary landowner Oszkár Nagyapáti has been battling severe drought on his land

events.title: Turkey and Armenia agree to simplify visa procedures to normalize ties
events.description: Turkey and Armenia have agreed to simplify visa procedures to normalize ties, Turkey's Foreign Ministry announced Monday

events.title: Mexican president says 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico
events.description: Mexican president says 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico

events.title: Taiwan's aviation authority says more than 100,000 air travelers will be affected by China military drills
events.description: Taiwan's aviation authority says more than 100,000 air travelers will be affected by China military drills

events.title: UK leader criticized for applauding return of man freed from Egyptian prison as old tweets resurface
events.description: The U.K. prime minister is facing criticism after celebrating the return of human rights activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah from Egypt

events.title: Young Africans find hope in farming as urban life becomes too expensive
events.description: Farming has long been seen as low-status work across much of Africa, pushing young people to cities in search of office jobs

events.title: Gaza: Humanitarian response ongoing despite restrictions
events.description: Although “significant restrictions and impediments” continue to hamper humanitarian operations in Gaza, teams are still responding to the population’s needs, the UN aid coordination office OCHA said on Wednesday.

events.title: UN celebrates 10 years of progress in youth, peace and security agenda
events.description: The UN has long been at the forefront of efforts to involve young people in decision-making, and the last decade has seen significant progress, thanks to the adoption of a Security Council resolution on youth, peace and security which led to widespread changes in the ways that the voices of young people are not just heard, but also incorporated in peace plans and policies.

events.title: Gov Tim Walz responds to Minnesota fraud allegations following viral daycare video and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Feds say man accused of planting DC pipe bombs confessed, admitting he targeted both parties
events.description: Man accused of Jan. 6 pipe bombs allegedly confessed he felt compelled to "speak up" for those who believed 2020 election was stolen, prosecutors say.

events.title: Deadly midair helicopter collision in New Jersey kills 2
events.description: Two helicopters collided midair in Hammonton, New Jersey, killing both pilots, authorities said.

events.title: Head of America's 'free enterprise' college optimistic about academia despite left-wing bias: 'there is hope'
events.description: University president shares new hope for higher education at AmericaFest, promoting free enterprise values and civility on campus amid academic challenges.

events.title: Zelenskyy claims Trump said US will consider giving Ukraine decades of security guarantees
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy indicated that American President Donald Trump said the U.S. will entertain the prospect of providing Ukraine with decades of security guarantees.

events.title: UK prime minister slammed for welcoming home freed Egyptian prisoner after social media posts resurface
events.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing criticism after welcoming human rights activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah home, as the man's past posts sparked political backlash.

events.title: Trio of Palestinians arrested for allegedly torching Christmas tree at Catholic church in West Bank
events.description: Three Palestinians accused of torching a Christmas tree and damaging part of a Nativity scene at a West Bank Catholic church were arrested.
